resources.string: Please note that The Witcher Tabletop RPG\'s rules and mechanics differ from traditional Dungeons and Dragons. This application serves as a tool meant to be used alongside The Witcher Tabletop RPG Core Rulebook and follows the rules and mechanics set by it. Use of The Witcher Tabletop RPG Core Rulebook is strongly recommended as this application does not contain all of the information necessary to learn how to play. This is an unofficial application and is not approved/endorsed by CD PROJEKT RED or R. Talsorian Games. This application is not a licensed product. I do not claim ownership of any information, icons, or images used throughout the app. Copyrights and/or trademarks of any information, icons, and/or images used belong to their respective owners.

Thank you for downloading The Witcher TRPG Companion App. This application is a passion/learning project and it is meant to speed up character creation and role-playing while playing The Witcher Tabletop RPG. Since I am the sole contributor to the application, some key features have not been implemented to reduce complexity and development time. Some of which include crafting, armor/weapon enhancements, and mutations. I have implemented alternatives such as custom items, equipment notes, and stat/skill modifiers to have a similar functionality as said features. If you have any feedback or concerns regarding the application or it\'s content, please do not hesitate to leave a review and I will try to respond to it as soon as possible.

This is the character information section. Here you will be able to access common stats such as your current health, stamina, and crowns. You can also add a character image, access information regarding your profession, edit character personal information, and add background events. To navigate through the rest of the application, tap the navigation drawer icon at the top left of the screen.

This is the character skills section. Skills can have between 0 and 10 points in them and can never go higher than 10 points. Bonuses like racial modifiers can raise a skill above 10. When first making your character, your skills cap at 6. To increase a skill point, the current level of that skill will be subtracted from your improvement point total. To edit a skill\'s modifier, click and hold on the skill until the modifier indicator appears next to the skill level. Keep in mind that modifiers do not reduce your improvement points total and are usually obtained from racial perks, items, equipment, injuries, or consumables.

This is the statistics section. The Statistic Cap is 10, however, Mutations and Racial traits can raise Statistics above this cap. The numbers displayed include your raw stat value plus any modifiers. To edit a stat\'s modifier, click and hold a stat until the modifier is shown. Keep in mind that modifiers do not reduce your improvement points total and are usually obtained from racial perks, items, equipment, injuries, or consumables.
